title: nefunkční přihlášení k bankovnímu účtu

Pro obnovení stiskněte Ctrl+F5, nebo Ctrl+Shift+F5." Poradí někdo jak nastavit Firefox, aby nedocházelo k tomuto problému ? Dochází k němu až v posledních asi dvou měsících, dříve nikoli.

title: Does FireFox and Chrome handle data from an API differently?
content:
Note: I am asking this question here and in Google Chrome forums.

I am retrieving data from the eBird API. I am displaying it on a web page using JavaScript.

There is nothing really fancy in my code. The records are coming in to my JavaScript code from the API. I am putting each record in newly created div elements using JavaScript. But, in Chrome in both Android and Windows 10, the data is not being displayed properly.

If I run the same web page using FireFox in Windows 10, I can see all the records coming from the API.

Is there something different in the way Chrome and FireFox handle data like this?

Here is the eBird API end point that I am using:

https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/664302/S1ENwy59?version=latest#397b9b8c-4ab9-4136-baae-3ffa4e5b26e4

I attached a screenshot of what is happening in Chrome. I added the orange arrow to point out where Chrome is having problems. Nothing is displayed after that point.

NOTE: There are no errors being displayed when I use the Developers Tools. When I check the Elements tab in the Dev Tools, I can see all the records that should be displayed on the web page. So, the data is coming in. It is just not being displayed on the web page.

I attached a screenshot of what is happening in FireFox. (Nothing! Everything works!) You can see from the scroll bar marked with the blue arrow on the right side that there is a lot more data to be displayed. FireFox displays all of the records. The orange arrow marks where Chrome stopped.

content:

My Mac OS is up to date and I have no issues with LinkedIn on Safari or Chrome. But I do prefer FireFox and would hate to have to change my default browser because of this issue.

Any thoughts, suggestions and ideas are greatly welcomed.

Thanks in advance, Sally.

title: search engine(s)
content:
I'm a dinosaur when it comes to the world of electronics primarily computers, so I will probably use the wrong term(s) when trying to describe what I'm looking for. 

   I was directed to Mozilla/Firefox several years ago by a computer repair person. I downloaded Firefox on my desktop tower computer. If I remember correctly the repair person referred to Firefox as a "browser". I was also directed to a "search engine" by the name of "Duck Duck Go". I was informed that these two (2) products worked well together. So I downloaded Firefox and Duck Duck Go on my desktop and they have worked well together. I now have noticed that Mozilla/Firefox are promoting Firefox as a search engine also and not really recommending Duck Duck Go anymore, by not mentioning it.    So here's my dilemma. Do I make sure that I have the most recent version of Firefox on my computer and if I do, then do I download Firefox as my new search engine? If I don't have the latest version of Firefox on my computer then I will download both new programs. Is changing the search engine to Firefox the best decision? I know, I know, I'm asking the Fox to guard the hen house,  no pun

intended. 

       Thank You,         Karl Becker        Email address: moondanceacre@gmail.com
creator: moondanceacre

title: Force installed addon shows permission popup on adding matches.
content:
I have force installed a firefox addon my adding entries in the following location in a resgitry- Computer\HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Mozilla\Firefox\Extensions\Install (extension path) Computer\HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Mozilla\Firefox\Extensions\Locked (extension-id)

The extension was installed successfully. But when I add more matches and update the extension it shows a popup asking the user to allow for the newly added permision. Is this expected behaviour. I am asking this since in case of chrome these popups don't appear for force installed extensions even after adding new matches. Can I make any more changes in policies to fix this?

title: Firefox slower than Chrome in LAN speed test
content:
Hello,

I've noticed a weird issue with Firefox while running a self-hosted speed test app on my LAN. In Firefox on MacOS 10.14.6, I get much slower speeds than in Chrome on the same machine (2012 Mac mini). As you can see in the attached screenshots, Chrome maxes out my LAN bandwidth at ~988 Mbps (entire network is 1000 Mbps ethernet) but Firefox only achieves ~642 Mbps. This was done on the same computer, just in the two different browsers and just a minute or so apart. I also tried Firefox in Private Mode and got the same ~650 Mbps result. I've done this repeatedly throughout the day and always get almost the same results; Firefox never gets over ~650 Mbps.

I also tried Firefox on an Ubuntu machine and get almost identical results as Chrome does on MacOS... ~985 Mbps. So it seems like Firefox is Ok on Ubuntu, but slower for some reason on MacOS.

I would expect the two to be about the same in terms of raw throughput. Does anyone know what might cause this and is there any way to fix it?
creator: interconnect

title: white bar above firefox
content:
Heya!

When using Firefox (newest Version) in full screen I'm getting a white bar above firefox shown on the monitor above. (Screenshot attached). This only happens in full screen mode. Thing's I've found out while trying to fix this:

- It disappears when I use F11 to fullscreen the website. When disableing the fullscreen, the bar reappears, but turns black (wtf?) - When I'm enabling the titlebar the white bar also disappears, but I don't want to do this since then I'm having a big white titlebar which is even worse

It's just an optical error but a fix would be highly appreciated. Things I tried yet;

- start in safe mod - clean reinstallation - disabled windows tablet mode - disabled hardware accleration

Note: this only happens in Firefox, all other programs works fine.
